009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019
020/**
021 * Works by matrix inversion  (naive).
022 * FAILS on PERFECT FIT!
023 * 
024 * Algebraic ellipse fit based on Fitzgibbon's original method [1], 
025 * as described in Halir and Flusser [2] (WITHOUT their numerical
026 * improvements).
027 * 
028 * [1] A. W. Fitzgibbon, M. Pilu, and R. B. Fisher. Direct least-
029 * squares fitting of ellipses. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis
030 * and Machine Intelligence 21(5), 476-480 (1999).
031 * 
032 * [2] R. Halíř and J. Flusser. Numerically stable direct least squares
033 * fitting of ellipses. In "Proceedings of the 6th International
034 * Conference in Central Europe on Computer Graphics and Visualization
035 * (WSCG’98)", pp. 125-132, Plzeň, CZ (February 1998).
036 * 
037 * @author WB
038 *
039 */
040public class EllipseFitFitzgibbonNaive implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
041        
042        private final double[] p;       // p = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
043        
044        public EllipseFitFitzgibbonNaive(Pnt2d[] points) {
045                this.p = fit(points);
046        }
047
048        @Override
049        public double[] getParameters() {
050                return this.p;
051        }
052        
053        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points) {
054                final int n = points.length;
055
056                // create design matrix X:
057                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 6);
058                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
059                        double x = points[i].getX();
060                        double y = points[i].getY();
061                        X.setEntry(i, 0, sqr(x));
062                        X.setEntry(i, 1, x * y);
063                        X.setEntry(i, 2, sqr(y));
064                        X.setEntry(i, 3, x);
065                        X.setEntry(i, 4, y);
066                        X.setEntry(i, 5, 1);
067                }
068                
069                RealMatrix S = X.transpose().multiply(X);
070//              IJ.log("S = \n" + Matrix.toString(S.getData()));
071                
072//              SingularValueDecomposition svdS = new SingularValueDecomposition(S);
073//              IJ.log("rank(S) = " + svdS.getRank());
074//              IJ.log("   singular values = "  + Matrix.toString(svdS.getSingularValues()));
075//              IJ.log("   condition no = " + svdS.getConditionNumber());
076                
077                RealMatrix C = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(6, 6);
078                C.setEntry(0, 2, 2);
079                C.setEntry(1, 1, -1);
080                C.setEntry(2, 0, 2);
081                
082                RealMatrix Si = MatrixUtils.inverse(S, 1e-15);
083//              IJ.log("Si = \n" + Matrix.toString(Si.getData()));
084                
085                RealMatrix SiB = Si.multiply(C);
086                
087//              SingularValueDecomposition svdSiB = new SingularValueDecomposition(SiB);
088//              IJ.log("rank(SiB) = " + svdSiB.getRank());
089//              IJ.log("  singular values = "  + Matrix.toString(svdSiB.getSingularValues()));
090//              IJ.log("  condition no = " + svdSiB.getConditionNumber());
091                
092                
093                EigenDecomposition ed = new EigenDecomposition(SiB);
094//              IJ.log("nonsingular = " + ed.getSolver().isNonSingular());
095                
096                
097//              IJ.log("det(SiB) = " + ed.getDeterminant());
098//              PrintPrecision.set(10);
099//              IJ.log("eigenvalues = "  + Matrix.toString(ed.getRealEigenvalues()));
100                
101                double[] evals = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
102                int k = getLargestPositiveIdx(evals);
103//              IJ.log("idx k = " + k);
104//              IJ.log("eval(k) = " + evals[k]);
105                RealVector p = ed.getEigenvector(k);
106                
107                //p.mapDivideToSelf(p.getNorm());
108                return p.toArray();
109        }
110        
111        private int getLargestPositiveIdx(double[] x) {
112                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
113                int maxidx = -1;
114                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
115                        if (Double.isFinite(x[i]) && x[i] >= 0 && x[i] > maxval) {
116                                maxval = x[i];
117                                maxidx = i;
118                        }
119                }
120                return maxidx;
121        }
122        
123//      private int getSmallestPositiveIdx(double[] x) {
124//              double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
125//              int minidx = -1;
126//              for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
127//                      if (x[i] > 1e-9 && x[i] < minval) {
128//                              minval = x[i];
129//                              minidx = i;
130//                      }
131//              }
132//              return minidx;
133//      }
134        
135}
